questions.question_text: Common controls from UCF import into which table in ServiceNow?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Control Objective table

Selected Answer: B
UCF Citation [sn_comp_ucf_citation] = Citation [sn_compliance_citation]
UCF Control [sn_comp_ucf_control] = Control objective [sn_compliance_policy_statement]
UCF Authority Document [sn_comp_ucf_authority_document] = Authority document [sn_compliance_authority_document]
UCF Citation To Control [sn_comp_ucf_m2m_control_citation] = Control Objective to Citation [sn_compliance_m2m_statement_citation]

Selected Answer: B
Answer: B. sn_compliance_policy_statement
Explanation: UCF import contorls are stored in the UCF Control [sn_comp_ucf_control] and is mapped to the SN GRC Control Object[sn_compliance_policy_statement]
Source: PDI, sys_transform_map list view, filter: source_table=sn_comp_ucf_control

Selected Answer: B
Book: GRC: Integrated Risk Management (IRM) Implementation - San Diego P.17
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
Control objective

questions.question_text: An Entity can belong to one or multiple of which of the following?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
entity types

Selected Answer: A
GRC: Integrated Risk Management (IRM) Fundamentals Course, Lesson 3: Create an Entity Framework. https://nowlearning.servicenow.com/lxp/en/pages/learning-course?id=learning_course&course_id=9fe7eaaf977a91908934b67e6253af36&group_id=bc1qs8x6caxpkns9szm37d8csd6ej4nr67qx3hk732&child_id=bb38aaef977a91908934b67e6253afc9&spa=1
Entities can belong to more than one entity type.
An entity can belong to many entity types, but it can have only one entity class.
A IS CORRECT

Selected Answer: A
Entities can belong to multiple entity types.
entities can belong to one or more entity types as well

questions.question_text: When reviewing the Control Objective Table form with your customer, what are the most common choice lists to be configured? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCD
When reviewing the Control Objective Table form with your customer, what are the most common choice lists to be configured? (Choose three.)
 A. Reference
 B. Classification
 C. Category
 D. Type
 E. Description
Answer: 
 B. Classification
 C. Category
 D. Type
Explanation:
 - referece | string
 - Classification | Reference | Choice Dropdown
 - Category | Reference | Choice Dropdown
 - Type | Reference | Choice Dropdown
 - Description | string
Source: PDI, sys_object related list under table: Control Object
BCD is the correct answer : https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/utah-governance-risk-compliance/page/product/grc-policy-and-compliance/task/t_CreateAPolicyStatement.html

Selected Answer: D
Tablename.CONFIG - Opens configuration in a separate browser tab
Tablename.config - Opens configuration of table within content frame.

Selected Answer: D
D is right Answer. If it is Tablename.CONFIG then A.

Selected Answer: D
Agree on D: Inside the Content Frame
if .config is all lower case, then D is the right answer. If it was tablename.CONFIG then it would open in a new browser tab. So in this case D is the correct answer.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct- tested in instance. 
A is technically correct too, it is displayed in the browser tab, not opening a new one, but D is definitely the answer ServiceNow would want I think.
D is correct. Reference: ebook GRC:IRM Implementation
It is D.

comments.content: I was wrong. The answer is D

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
I literally just did it on our platform.

.CONFIG would be A
.config would be D

Selected Answer: D
so sorry D also is correct

Selected Answer: A
a is correct : it display the configuration in browser tab not new tab

Selected Answer: D
D

choices.B: Displays the table in list view within the Content Frame
choices.A: Displays the configuration list view of the table in the browser tab
choices.C: Displays the table in list view within a separate browser tab
choices.D: Displays the configuration list view of the table in the Content Frame

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
A & C are not defined roles in ServiceNow

Selected Answer: BD
Control Owner and Process Owner are not roles.

BD
